text: Frank Holmes Tyson (6 June 1930 - 27 September 2015) was an English cricketer and journalist. In the 1950s, he played 17 Test matches, taking 76 wickets at an outstanding bowling average of 18.56. He was a fast bowler and was given the nickname "Typhoon Tyson" for his speed. Tyson was born in Farnworth, Lancashire. In 1960, he moved to Australia and became a journalist. He was married to Ursula and had three children. Tyson died on 27 September 2015 on the Gold Coast in Queensland. He was 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * Player profile: Frank Tyson from ESPNcricinfo * Player profile: Frank Tyson from CricketArchive Category:1930 births Category:2015 deaths Category:British teachers Category:Disease-related deaths in Queensland Category:English and Welsh cricketers Category:English journalists Category:English sports commentators Category:Sportspeople from Lancashire
title: Frank Tyson
